address: 47 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

reviews.text: Stumbled upon this place while looking for a place to eat and was pleasantly surprised. Love the dry Sichuan Chicken! Perfect amount of spice.  Clean restaurant and super fast service. Would come here again!
I just had the boneless sea bass fish fillets with pickled vegetables in broth and it was a delight ! Really well cooked, spicy lemonish unique flavor that will remain forever in my memory ğŸ˜‹

The Best Sichuan truly is the best! Whether Iâ€™ve visited on a weekday or weekend, I know I can expect a calm, comfortable environment and quick, thoughtful service. All of the food Iâ€™ve tried from the menu is wonderful, particularly their hot & sour soup, chili oil dumplings, Dan Dan noodles, and any of their beef, chicken, or pork dishes. Over the last few years, itâ€™s definitely a go-to whenever I find myself in midtown, and I always recommend it to friends or family visiting the city if theyâ€™re near Bryant Park.
Good restaurant
Good!

My Fav! Pork soup dumpling outstanding! Incredible! Lo Main unbelievable, I always come here when I want some Chinese comfy easy place! And they are open until late night so it never disappoints me.
The food is delicious. The waitress was kind of messy but they were nice.

Great! I got the pork lo mein. Delicious, huge portion for the price $16. i would've only liked the dish to be more charred. It was incredible anyway though definitely my go-to chinese place in that area.

Love the dry Sichuan Chicken and Dumplings with Chilli oil! Came back again 2 days later and ordered exactly the same thing. Service is excellent and food equally so. Highly recommended if you crave Sichuan food in NYC!

Iâ€™ve been to this restaurant three times. At first, I thought their Yu Xiang Rou Si (shredded pork in garlic sauce) was really tasty. Today I tried the stir-fried minced pork with pickled long beansâ€”it was also quite good, with just the right level of spiciness and perfect with rice. However, the pork strips in todayâ€™s Yu Xiang Rou Si were a bit too thick, though the flavor was still as good as always. From what I remember, the Mao Xue Wang (spicy blood curd hotpot) was just average, and their signature lemon fish wasnâ€™t that impressive either. Overall, a few of their dishes are excellent, but not all of them hit the mark. Iâ€™ll definitely come back again!

Traditional style decoration, unique, cozy environment.
Food was delicious ï¼Œwe like the duck.
Service was excellent , quick seat, refill water.
Only thing is they seem like prefer you quickly finish if others are start waiting in the lobby. And

Note and caution: the 18% tip already included in the bill. Do not double tip

The food doesnâ€™t taste bad but itâ€™s not authentic. The flavors and also the spice level is changed and adjusted to the palette of white people. Even the sauces and flavor taste different compared to the real dish.

Had brunch here on a Sunday and it wasnâ€™t packed. The food was a tad pricey and the serving size was just right. The entrees we had didn't come with rice so we had to order that separately. The dishes tasted great and looked authentic. The dining areaâ€™s lighting and ambiance was subdued and quiet. The staff was friendly and service was pretty quick.

Hands down the best Chinese food Iâ€™ve ever eatenâ€”nothing else even comes close. Every bite was packed with flavor, perfectly balanced, and clearly made with fresh, high-quality ingredients.
The portions were generous, the service was quick and friendly, and the entire meal felt like a celebration. You can tell they really care about the food they serve. Iâ€™ll be dreaming about this place until I come backâ€”this is now my go-to spot for Chinese cuisine.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for authentic, unforgettable Chinese food!

My husband and I love sichuan food, so we go and try places anywhere we can. NY, of course, has plenty. Most of the time we get mapo tofu and sichuan chicken so we can fairly compare. This place was absolutely delicious. We got a lunch special, so it came with soup and the price was fantastic. Highly recommend
The food was so good! We got the grilled fish that was spicy. Portion was big and it came with different vegetables. Server was very attentive without too disrupting the meal.

I chose the highest-rated place for lunchâ€”4.7 stars is really impressive. Asian cuisine is especially appreciated in New York, and Iâ€™ve visited several spots already and enjoyed them all. I had no doubt this one would be great too.

I ordered the duck at its original price, without the lunch discount. Peking duck is a national dishâ€”youâ€™ve got to try it. The picture definitely looked appetizing.

However, when the duck arrived, it turned out to be dry, tough, and wind-driedâ€”not very tasty. I also ordered eggplant, but that wasnâ€™t impressive either. It was mildly spicy, but the sauce was oily and bland.

I paid just $44 without tip for one person.
But honestly, the meal felt like it was worth about $20.

Maybe the restaurant should consider hiring a more professional kitchen team.

I got the lunch special for takeout from here twice and I really enjoyed it! It's a ton of food (probably enough for two meals), and the fish dishes are absolutely packed with fish. Fast turnaround and great value!

Best Chinese meal for us this trip to NYC. Ordered the Fried Pork Dumplings (we asked for black vinegar and sliced ginger), Mapo Tofu and Garlic Sauce Pork strips. With steamed rice. Satisfied. Thank you and Good luck.

We discovered a late-night spot in The Best Sichuan, a cozy spot that saved us from a rumbling stomach when most kitchens were closed. The restaurant was decently filled, but quiet and had an okay ambience. The staff was friendly and welcoming. For the starters, The egg drop soup and pork wantons were average, but the main course : fish filet with tofu and hot sauce chicken were good and spicy. The portion sizes were huge, and the leftovers tasted even better the next day. If you're craving food late at night, The Best Sichuan is a solid option.
food are great, environment is nice and cozy, some dish is much  smaller than in the menu picture

The dumplings and buns are absolutely incredible when paired with the drinks! The atmosphere is vibrant and gives off great vibes, and you can soak up the buzz from the conversations around you. Overall, itâ€™s definitely the place to be!

Dine in 2 people. Gratuity is already included which is fine, but you should inform the customer before sit down. I have never seen any restaurant do like this before . And the worst thing is no service at allâ€¦ you just come to take orders and leave us alone Totally disappear ğŸ«¥ just sit down at front and play phone â€¦ not even fill the water â€¦ I think itâ€™s not fair for me at all . I feel so bad to be honest . No service but already charged the service fee. You think make money this way is very easy right?

We got in late right before closing time, and the staff was friendly and attentive, all while trying to get ready to close. My wife and I shared two plates, and we got the shrimp lo mein and the sesame chicken. Both were amazing and flavorful. I wish we had more time to try more of the food. It's definitely worth stopping in.

Looking for a good review for Sichuan while in midtown, found this spot and decided to try. This place lives up to its name! Fantastic menu you would not see everywhere - great casual vibe, quick and super friendly service, priced right, and exceptional flavors. Ordered spicy green beans that were excellent, dry pepper chicken, and hot garlic pork. All perfect! Will definitely return! For folks looking for the customary American Chinese dishes, you'll definitely find those on the menu, though. There's so much more interesting items to choose from that you just don't see everywhere.

Overall, Iâ€™d rate this place 9.86/10.  The food was amazing and it lives up to the restaurants name. The ambiance of the restaurant was nice, it wasnâ€™t too loud, and the servers were all kind and understanding.  We were even offered a larger table when we asked.  If you want some spicy and rich food, definitely come here.  9.86/10, would 100% recommend :)

Beautiful restaurant in the heart of the business district. Tho barely a conversation with me as far as food offerings. The first waiter pointed to the lunch menu and walked away.

but gave the white couple beside me a welcome and beautiful greeting. is what it is.

The food is SO GOOD. The dumplings are worth the price and the sesame chicken is LARGE and tasty. 8/10
Tolles Restaurant mit nettem Service. Eine Portion gebratenen Reis oder Nudeln gibt es fÃ¼r 15 $. Die Portionen sind sehr groÃŸ und machen locker 2 Personen satt. Geheimtipp mitten in Manhattan.

Probably the most flavorless Sichuan food I've had - the beef lacked the natural meaty taste and instead had the astringency of tenderizer; the gravy wasn't salty or savory - it was devoid of flavor. The brown rice was well-cooked though, funnily enough. I'm very disappointed, especially given that I made a last minute decision to come here instead of a nearby Sichuan restaurant after seeing the high ratings here.
Cena estupenda, comoda deliciosa y un gran servicio. Raciones generosas. Para ir con hambre. 100% recomendado.

We in town for the night and really wanted some good Asian food. We found this place and was so glad we did. They were open late night which was perfect. The service was really quick. And the people were helpful. I would def be back to try different things

I only got the spicy beef noodle soup here and it is really good! Very spicy, you get a ton of beef that is super tender, broth is rich, and the noodles are thicker. Not handpulled, but a wide noodle which I personally love so much! I should try other things on the menu, but I loved the dish so much that each time I come back I get the same thing

Your American â€œSzechuanâ€ food in the heart of manhattan. Itâ€™s nothing like the authentic Szechuan flavor we were hoping for but it was good enough and conveniently open till very late.

Donâ€™t get your hopes up - it will do the job but itâ€™s not authentic Szechuanese food. Itâ€™s better than your avg American Chinese diner.
Cibo cinese e giapponese buono ma come da pronostico prezzo molto alto rispetto all.italia con mancia obbligatoria.  Servizio veloce perlomeno.
i really enjoyed the food here, the service is also very good.

The service was excellent! Both waiters are super kind and helpful. The rotten eggs were perfectğŸ¤¤ and the pork garlic sauce and kung pao chicken were amazingğŸ¤Œ Will be back soon!

- @GoerToEat

So my friends and I chose this place plainly off of their 4.6 rating on Google and we absolutely loved it. It was not busy, the service was fast and great. The waitresses were friendly and offered to give us hot tea that could help with my sore throat. The food was flavorful and tasted amazing. Iâ€™d definitely come back here again

The food was amazing. I got to eat something I hadnâ€™t in 4 years and it brought back so many fond memories and tasted even better than I remembered. They also offered us warm tea when I mentioned I was feeling sick. I will definitely come back here my next time in NYC.
Service is top tier- fast and friendly. All round great food and service
super friendly staff in a cozy and clean restaurant with great authentic and Americanized Chinese options!

Mitten in Manhattan ein kÃ¶stliches, authentisches und  erschwingliches Essen in tollem Ambiente.

Und VORSICHT : wenn da steht "hot" meint das wirklich scharf :-)

The food here is absolutely delicious, and the service is excellent, friendly and attentive. One downside is the portion sizes, which are smaller than expected. However, the overall experience is still very good. Plus, theyâ€™re open late, making it a great spot for a late-night bite. Definitely worth our visit!

This Chinese restaurant is a fantastic find! The food is incredibly tasty, and the portions are impressively large, so come hungry. We ordered the duck and fish, and both dishes were deliciousâ€”full of flavor and cooked to perfection. The duck was tender with a crispy skin, and the fish was fresh and well-seasoned. The generous portions mean you definitely get your moneyâ€™s worth. If youâ€™re looking for a place with great food and substantial servings, this is a must-try. Highly recommended!

Lovely food, great ambiance. We got the mapo tofu and garlic chicken
With milder flavors, this place is great for casual eats. More of a homey hole in the wall kind of restaurant.

Great meal experience here.  Strong, attentive service that was not expected from an authentic Chinese restaurant.  And terrific food - even by my Chinese spouse - that was consistently good all around.  Will be going back again the next time in NYC.
A very nice setting and the food was cooked with so much flavor! The spiciness was balanced out perfectly in all the dishes. Would recommend the twice cooked pork; thatâ€™s totally a winner!
